item.title: Friday Briefing: U.S. Presidential Race at a Crossroads
item.description: Plus, security failures at the Trump rally.

item.title: Von der Leyen Secures Second E.U. Term, but It’s a New World Out There
item.description: The German conservative, a steadfast U.S. ally, gained European Parliament approval to lead the European Commission for another five years. She’ll face tumult at home and abroad.

item.title: Pressure Mounts on Netanyahu to Seal a Cease-Fire Deal Before Speech to Congress
item.description: The Israeli leader’s speech before a divided Congress next week is likely to be contentious, particularly if he does not close a deal with Hamas to end the war before he travels to Washington.

item.title: America’s Allies in Middle East See Some Advantages in Potential 2nd Trump Presidency
item.description: As Republicans meet this week for their convention, leaders in Israel, Saudi Arabia and Egypt are considering what a second Trump presidency could mean for their domestic and regional agendas.

item.title: Zelensky Among European Leaders Meeting in Churchill’s Birthplace
item.description: More than 45 European leaders, including President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine, met in England on Thursday. Fears over the continent’s security loomed large.

item.title: Thursday Briefing: J.D. Vance Takes the Stage
item.description: Plus, Israel estimates the toll on Hamas.

item.title: Pentagon Warns ISIS Attacks Could Double This Year
item.description: Attacks claimed by ISIS in Iraq and Syria are on track to double last year’s total, the U.S. military said in a report, as the terrorist group’s affiliates become increasingly deadly elsewhere around the world.

item.title: E.U. Court Rebukes European Commission Over Covid Vaccine Contracts
item.description: The court ruled that the European Commission wrongly withheld information, casting a shadow on its leader, Ursula von der Leyen, before a crucial vote on her future.

item.title: King’s Speech Promises a Changed U.K.
item.description: From plans to tackle climate change to ending the role of hereditary legislators, the ceremonial King’s Speech showcased the progressive priorities of Britain’s Labour government.

item.title: Israel’s Military Says It Eliminated Half the Leadership of Hamas Military Wing
item.description: The military said that it had killed or captured around 14,000 combatants in Gaza since the war’s start but left considerable ambiguity about the figure.

item.title: Biden vs. His Party
item.description: The Democratic Party’s Biden dilemma is unresolved, even as the momentum against him slows.

item.title: Trump Says Taiwan Should Pay for U.S. Defense
item.description: Trump also accused Taiwan of sinking the U.S. semiconductor sector, signaling he wants a more transactional approach to shielding the island from China.

item.title: How France Blocked the Far Right
item.description: The French had a far-right government before, one that collaborated with the Nazis. When casting ballots even today, that is not an easy thing to forget.

item.title: Wednesday Briefing
item.description: President Biden’s growing isolation.

item.title: Russian Orthodox Church Wages a ‘Holy War’ Against Satanism, and the West
item.description: A battle has erupted in Moldova over its links to the Russian Orthodox Church, seen by many as a tool of Moscow’s influence abroad.

item.title: Israeli Strikes Kill Over 20 and Hit Another U.N. Building in Gaza
item.description: The Israeli military said it was targeting militants operating in a U.N. school being used as a shelter in Nuseirat. A second strike caused fatalities in Al-Mawasi, the Gazan Health Ministry said.

item.title: Wednesday Briefing: A Turbulent Moment in U.S. Politics
item.description: Plus, Israeli strikes killed more than 20 people in Gaza.

item.title: Bangladesh Deploys Border Force to Try to Quell Student Protests
item.description: Across the country, students have taken to the streets over job quotas that they say limit their opportunities.

item.title: U.S. Detected Potential Iranian Plot to Kill Trump Separate From Saturday’s Shooting
item.description: American intelligence agencies were tracking an Iranian threat even before the attack on former President Donald J. Trump. But officials said the two were unrelated.

item.description:
1. Biden in crisis  POLITICO
  2. People Close to Biden Say He Appears to Accept He May Have to Leave the Race  The New York Times
  3. What happens if Biden drops out of presidential race?  KRON4
  4. The End of Biden’s Candidacy Approaches  The Atlantic
  5. Democrats brace for the possibility Biden drops out of 2024 race: 'We're close to the end'  NBC News

item.title: Covid's summer wave surges on as Biden tests positive - NBC News
item.description:
1. Covid's summer wave surges on as Biden tests positive  NBC News
  2. ‘I’m Sick’: Biden Uses Positive COVID Test to Take Dig at Musk and Trump  TIME
  3. Biden has COVID-19 and didn't wear a mask. The CDC's guidelines say he doesn't have to  ABC News
  4. Biden just got covid. What are the latest coronavirus guidelines?  The Washington Post
  5. Video: Dr. Gupta highlights something to watch out for with Biden’s Covid diagnosis  CNN

item.title: Israeli strike kills field commander in elite Hezbollah unit: Sources
Zelenskiy to attend UK cabinet meeting in effort to disrupt Russian oil sales
item.description:
Ukraine’s president will ask for more help to block Putin’s growing ‘shadow fleet’ of tankers carrying sanctioned crude to buyers

The Ukrainian president, Volodmyr Zelenskiy, will attend an extraordinary meeting of the British cabinet on Friday to bring fresh impetus to efforts to stop Russia evading sanctions on its oil exports.

Zelenskiy will be the first foreign leader to visit Downing Street since Keir Starmer was elected prime minister two weeks ago and the first foreign leader to address cabinet in person since the US president Bill Clinton in 1997.

Continue reading...

J.D. Vance Accused of Hypocrisy for Changing Own Name but Opposing Trans Rights
Italy carrier strike group joins Australia war games, will visit Philippines
Trump turns up heat on Fed ahead of expected rate cuts: 'It's something that they know they shouldn’t be doing.'
Russia says 'let's be realistic' about Trump plan to end Ukraine war
